questions.question_text: NGFW mode allows policy-based configured for most inspection rules. Which security profile's configuration does not change when you enable policy-based inspection?

discussion.content: proxy addresses are used only in proxy policies, in proxy addresses , HTTP methods are used as source addresses in proxy polices.
According to the guide in the Proxy Address Types the HTTP Methods are used in Proxy Policies. So, "B" is right.
B is right
any clue which one is the right answer?
https://help.fortinet.com/fos60hlp/60/Content/FortiOS/fortigate-firewall/Configuration%20-%20Web%20Proxy/General%20explicit%20web%20proxy%20configuration%20steps.htm

choices.B: As the source in a proxy policy.
choices.A: As the source in a firewall policy.
choices.C: As the destination in a firewall policy.
choices.D: As the destination in a proxy policy.

questions.question_text: Which statement about the IP authentication header (AH) used by IPsec is true?

discussion.content: True is C, you 're right

The answer is C. 
The FortiGate_Infrastructure_6.2_Study_Guide-Online (page 197) says: 
"IPsec is a suite of protocols that is used for authenticating and encrypting traffic between two peers. The threemost used protocols in the suite are the following:

- Internet Key Exchange (IKE), which does the handshake, tunnel maintenance, and disconnection.
- Encapsulation Security Payload (ESP), which ensures data integrity and encryption.
- Authentication Header (AH), which offers only data integrity - not encryption."

choices.D: AH provides strong data integrity but weak encryption.
choices.C: AH provides data integrity bur no encryption.
choices.A: AH does not provide any data integrity or encryption.
choices.B: AH does not support perfect forward secrecy.
